item.title: Tour Napa Valley's sparkling wines
item.description:
Tour Napa Valley's sparkling wines

20 wines under $20 Where to get the best wine in NYC Add some sparkle to your next trip to California. The Napa Valley, long known for its bold cabernets and big, oaky chardonnays, has a lot to offer fans of bubblies, with several wineries making sparklers in the traditional method of champagne, but without all the pretense.

item.title: Napa Smith Brewery to expand to Vallejo, Nashville
item.description:
Napa Smith Brewery to expand to Vallejo, Nashville

Napa Smith Brewery announced Tuesday that it will expand its operations outside of Napa to two new facilities, one located in Vallejo and another in Nashville. Napa Smith said it expects to open its Vallejo plant by the end of the year. It also will enter into a partnership with Turtle Anarchy Brewing Co.

item.title: Dominus 2013 Marks 30th Vintage
item.description:
Dominus 2013 Marks 30th Vintage

YOUNTVILLE, Calif. , May 23, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- To celebrate the 30th vintage of Dominus as well as an exceptional year for Napa Valley , the 2013 label dons a special portrait of Christian Moueix by William Kentridge . Kentridge is a South African artist internationally known for his prints, drawings, animations and more recently, stage design for opera.

item.title: A Trip Back to the 1800's: A Stop Through Some of the Oldest Vineyards in Napa
item.description:
A Trip Back to the 1800's: A Stop Through Some of the Oldest Vineyards in Napa

Joshua Arroyo, our fantastic host at Chappellet Winery This leads me to day three of our wine country excursion and another one of my favorite all-time stops. As you may recall, in November, I had the chance to sit down with the CEO of Chappellet Winery, Cyril Chappellet and had such a fun lunch that I knew this had to be a must stop during our trip.

item.title: Seasoned winemakers launch new valley brand
item.description:
Seasoned winemakers launch new valley brand

Doug Shafer and Elias Fernandez aren't winemakers who dwell on the past. They could, however, considering the success they've achieved in a three-decade-plus association at Shafer Vineyards that has consistently produced some of the area's best wines, ranging from remarkable Red Shoulder Ranch chardonnay to the Hillside Select cabernet sauvignon from the estate vineyard in the Stags Leap District.

item.title: Connoisseurs' Guide to California Wine
item.description:
Connoisseurs' Guide to California Wine

By Stephen Eliot One of the steady refrains in wine commentary these days is the call for a return to more "honest" times. Wine, we are told is losing its cultural relevance and soul as science, technology and technique have spawned what amounts to a hostile take-over of the winemaking craft, and "manipulation" has become tantamount to an unforgiveable sin.
